moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Nf6 3. c4 e6 4. dxe6 Bx: A normal Icelandic asset. White is not likely to be familiar with it.
moves.5. Qa4+: !? First time seen. Ok, let's see. Be wise.
moves.5... c6: This is my bet: it will cramp him more than me, because I was confortable with the N being developed through d7.
moves.6. Qb3: Threatening b7. But I had a quick flash, and I transformed b7 in a poisoned pawn. Can you guess  it?
moves.6... Bc5: This one, and not in itself, but if joined with the following, that is...
moves.7. Qxb7: (White could have survived by playing 7. Nc3 instead, and after Qd4, Nd1. With a very cramped game!)
moves.7... Qd4: Incredible as it seems, white has no defence against a storm.
moves.8. Qxa8: If Nh3, BxN, but it would have meant a piece less from me into the attack and a piece more for him to save. See...
moves.8... Qxf2+ 9. Kd1 Qxf1+: This could be avoided by Nh3.
moves.10. Kc2 Bf5+: My Nb8 is "en prise", as my R h8. Of course.
moves.11. Kb3 Qd1+: I can't allow him to have a tempo, so no QxB or Qxg2. He abandoned here, slaughered by an unexpected mortal attack that is often forgotten on the first moves. The following is forced:
